profile.name: Theo Yeh
profile.title: Staff Product Manager
profile.tagline: Staff Product Manager in health-tech marketplaces and growth
profile.intro: I build revenue-generating products and marketplace optimization strategies. At Roo, I led marketplace optimization and stood up a new business line outside the main marketplace, managing two cross-functional teams across product, engineering, design, growth, and marketing.

caseStudies.title: Roo Promotional Product & Lifecycle Motion
caseStudies.summary: Built and launched Roo's first promotional product, driving 20% YoY company-wide revenue growth and increasing vet retention by 30%, resulting in $25M incremental GMV.
caseStudies.context: Roo is a Series A marketplace connecting veterinary professionals with hospitals. As the company scaled, we needed new revenue levers and retention mechanisms beyond our core marketplace to sustain growth and reduce provider churn.
caseStudies.problem: Veterinarian retention was declining as the marketplace matured. We had no promotional products to incentivize repeat bookings, and account managers lacked tools to proactively engage and retain top providers. Revenue growth was plateauing without new product-driven growth levers.
caseStudies.myRole: Led product strategy, design, and launch as Senior/Staff PM. Managed cross-functional team including engineering, design, growth, and marketing. Owned the full product lifecycle from concept to scaled rollout.
whatIDid: Designed and launched Roo's first promotional product with targeted incentives for veterinarians to increase repeat bookings
Built self-service tools and workflows enabling account managers to independently close retention deals with top vets, eliminating manual bottlenecks
Originated and shipped marketplace features including Price Bidding and Auto-Confirmation, resulting in 15% YoY incremental bookings revenue
Created automated cancellation and shift recovery workflows that saved $479K in net revenue and recovered $200K in shifts
Drove a 670% increase in 'vets favoriting hospitals' metric, powering targeted lifecycle marketing campaigns

outcomes.description: Attributed to promotional product and lifecycle motion
Company-wide revenue increase driven by promotional product
Reduction in churn among participating veterinarians
Attributed to account manager tools retaining hundreds of vets monthly
Incremental revenue from marketplace features (Price Bidding, Auto-Confirmation)
In vets favoriting hospitals, enabling targeted campaigns

learnings: Promotional products need careful economic modeling‚Äîuncapped incentives can quickly erode margins. We iterated on caps and targeting to balance growth and profitability.
Empowering non-technical teams (account managers) with self-service tools multiplies impact. Building workflows they can operate independently scaled retention efforts 10x.
Marketplace features like auto-confirmation and bidding can unlock significant incremental revenue without adding supply or demand‚Äîoptimizing existing liquidity is underrated.
Metrics like 'favorites' can be leading indicators of engagement. Driving this metric early enabled us to build a powerful lifecycle marketing engine.

caseStudies.title: Roo Provider Mobile App (0‚Äì1)
caseStudies.summary: Built and launched Roo's first mobile app for providers, achieving a 4.8‚òÖ rating and centralizing 70% of provider bookings into the app.
keyOutcomes: 70% of provider bookings through mobile app
caseStudies.context: Roo initially operated as a web-only marketplace. Veterinary professionals needed on-the-go access to browse shifts, manage bookings, and communicate with hospitals. A mobile app was critical to improve provider experience and increase booking conversion.
caseStudies.problem: Providers were using the web platform on mobile browsers, leading to poor UX, low engagement, and missed booking opportunities. We had no native mobile presence, and competitors were launching mobile-first experiences.
caseStudies.myRole: Founding Product Manager for mobile. Owned end-to-end product strategy, roadmap, and launch. Collaborated with engineering, design, and operations to define MVP scope and post-launch iterations.
whatIDid: Defined product vision and MVP scope for Roo's first mobile app, prioritizing core booking and communication workflows
Led user research with veterinarians to validate feature priorities and design decisions
Worked with engineering and design to ship a high-quality iOS and Android app in 6 months
Implemented push notifications, shift alerts, and in-app messaging to drive engagement
Monitored post-launch metrics and iterated on onboarding, search, and booking flows to optimize conversion

outcomes.description: Average rating across iOS and Android app stores
Provider bookings shifted from web to mobile app

learnings: Mobile-first experiences are critical in gig marketplaces. Providers expect instant access and notifications‚Äîweb can't compete.
Onboarding flow quality directly impacts activation. We A/B tested multiple onboarding versions to maximize conversion.
Push notifications are a double-edged sword‚Äîhigh engagement, but over-notification leads to opt-outs. We dialed in frequency and relevance over time.

caseStudies.title: Roo Enterprise & Externship Platforms
caseStudies.summary: Expanded corporate hospital network by 200+ locations via Roo's first enterprise management/analytics platform. Launched the first externship marketplace, acquiring 600+ veterinarians and deepening academic partnerships.
caseStudies.context: Roo's marketplace initially served independent clinics and small hospital groups. To scale, we needed to onboard large corporate hospital chains (e.g., VCA, Banfield) and build relationships with veterinary schools to attract early-career talent.
caseStudies.problem: Corporate hospital chains had unique needs‚Äîcentralized billing, multi-location analytics, and compliance requirements. Veterinary schools wanted structured externship programs but had no digital tooling. We had no B2B or academic go-to-market motion.
caseStudies.myRole: Founding PM for enterprise and ecosystem products. Led cross-functional teams to design and ship enterprise management tools and the externship marketplace. Owned partnerships with corporate chains and veterinary schools.
whatIDid: Built Roo's first enterprise management platform with multi-location analytics, centralized billing, and admin controls
Onboarded 200+ corporate hospital locations by addressing their unique operational and compliance needs
Designed and launched an externship marketplace connecting veterinary students with clinics offering hands-on training programs
Partnered with veterinary schools to integrate externship programs into curriculum, acquiring 600+ early-career vets
Created dashboards and reporting tools for enterprise customers to track provider performance and booking trends

outcomes.description: Corporate hospital locations onboarded via enterprise platform

learnings: Enterprise sales require product differentiation. Self-service features don't work for corporate customers‚Äîthey need white-glove onboarding and custom tooling.
Academic partnerships are slow but compounding. Vet schools move cautiously, but once they adopt, they send cohorts of students year after year.
Multi-location analytics are table stakes for enterprise customers. They want visibility into provider quality, costs, and utilization across their network.

caseStudies.title: Procare $1M+ Enterprise Deployment & M&A Integrations
caseStudies.summary: Sole product and program lead for a multi-year $1M+ enterprise software deal, managing custom development and deployment across 430+ locations from kickoff through completion. Managed end-to-end business integration projects for two successful M&A transactions. Led three critical audits (2 PCI-DSS, 1 SOC2) from kickoff to successful closure.
caseStudies.context: Procare Solutions is a private equity-backed childcare SaaS provider. The company won a major enterprise contract requiring custom development and multi-year deployment. Additionally, PE-driven M&A activity required integrating acquired companies' products and teams.
caseStudies.problem: The enterprise customer had unique requirements not supported by our core product. M&A integrations were complex, involving disparate tech stacks, teams, and customer bases. We also needed to pass PCI-DSS and SOC2 audits to maintain enterprise credibility.
caseStudies.myRole: Project Manager and sole product lead for the $1M+ enterprise program. Owned custom development roadmap, deployment across 430+ locations, and stakeholder management. Led two M&A integration projects and three audit programs.
whatIDid: Managed end-to-end delivery of $1M+ enterprise software deployment from kickoff to completion across 430+ childcare locations
Coordinated custom development with engineering teams to meet enterprise customer's unique requirements
Led program management for two successful M&A integrations, merging products, teams, and customer bases
Owned three critical audit programs (2 PCI-DSS, 1 SOC2), coordinating cross-functional teams to achieve compliance
Built project plans, timelines, and risk mitigation strategies for complex, multi-stakeholder initiatives

outcomes.description: Successfully delivered across 430+ locations over multiple years
End-to-end business and product integrations post-acquisition
2 PCI-DSS and 1 SOC2 audits successfully closed

learnings: Enterprise deployments require ruthless prioritization. Customers want everything, but timelines and budgets force tradeoffs. Clear communication on scope is critical.
M&A integrations are as much about people as products. Aligning teams, processes, and cultures is harder than merging code.
Audit programs are high-stakes, low-feedback-loop initiatives. You don't know if you've succeeded until the auditor signs off. Over-preparation is underrated.

caseStudies.title: Presto Implementations & Operations
caseStudies.summary: Delivered four major hardware/software implementations, managing internal teams and strategic external partners. Acted as Scrum Master for two product teams. Oversaw daily content deployments to 2,052+ US locations and implemented a Jenkins-based reporting tool, improving data accuracy from 60% to 99%.
caseStudies.context: Presto provides AI-powered restaurant automation solutions. The company was scaling hardware/software deployments to thousands of restaurant locations while managing complex product development and daily operational content updates.
caseStudies.problem: Hardware/software implementations were high-touch and operationally complex. Product teams lacked structured agile processes. Daily content deployments to thousands of locations had low accuracy, creating operational overhead and customer dissatisfaction.
caseStudies.myRole: Project Manager for four major implementations, coordinating internal and external partners. Scrum Master for two product teams, managing sprints, epics, and user stories in JIRA. Operations lead for daily content deployments and reporting infrastructure.
whatIDid: Delivered four major hardware/software implementations, managing timelines, resources, and stakeholder communication
Acted as Scrum Master for two product teams, facilitating sprint planning, standups, retrospectives, and backlog grooming in JIRA
Managed daily content deployments to 2,052+ restaurant locations across the US, ensuring accuracy and uptime
Built and implemented a Jenkins-based reporting tool to monitor deployment success rates and identify failures in real-time
Improved content deployment accuracy from 60% to 99% through process improvements and automated monitoring

outcomes.description: Major hardware/software rollouts delivered on time
Data accuracy improvement via Jenkins-based reporting tool

learnings: Hardware + software deployments are exponentially more complex than pure software. Physical logistics, on-site issues, and third-party dependencies create unpredictability.
Scrum is a forcing function for clarity. Teams that resist sprint planning and backlog grooming are teams with unclear priorities.
Operational tooling compounds. A Jenkins-based reporting tool that took 2 weeks to build saved hundreds of hours of manual troubleshooting and improved customer satisfaction.

roles.title: Inside Sales
roles.description: Early career role in enterprise SaaS sales.

sections.title: Discovery & Strategy
sections.description: I specialize in building revenue-generating products in marketplace and health-tech environments. My approach combines deep customer research, competitive analysis, and strategic experimentation.
principles: Marketplaces: I've built and optimized two-sided marketplaces, focusing on liquidity, pricing mechanisms, and supply/demand balance. At Roo, I originated features like Price Bidding and Auto-Confirmation that drove 15% incremental revenue.

0‚Äì1 products: I thrive in ambiguous, early-stage environments. I've launched multiple products from scratch‚Äîmobile apps, enterprise platforms, and promotional products‚Äîturning strategy into shipped software.

Revenue motions: I focus on products that directly impact the bottom line. Whether it's promotional products ($25M GMV), lifecycle campaigns, or enterprise tools, I build with commercial outcomes in mind.

sections.title: Execution & Leadership
sections.description: I lead cross-functional teams through complex, high-stakes initiatives‚Äîfrom multi-year enterprise rollouts to fast-paced product launches.
principles: Cross-functional leadership: I've managed teams spanning product, engineering, design, growth, and marketing. I create clarity, alignment, and momentum across diverse stakeholders.

Enterprise delivery: I've led large-scale deployments ($1M+ deals, 430+ locations) and M&A integrations. I excel at managing complexity, risk, and stakeholder expectations in high-pressure environments.
Audit & compliance: I've owned critical audit programs (PCI-DSS, SOC2) from kickoff to closure. I understand how to balance speed with rigor in regulated environments.

sections.title: Experimentation & Lifecycle
sections.description: I use data-driven experimentation and lifecycle marketing to optimize product performance and customer retention.
principles: Promotional products: I've designed and scaled promotional mechanics that balance growth and profitability. At Roo, I launched the first promotional product, driving 20% YoY revenue growth while maintaining unit economics.

Lifecycle campaigns: I build products that power lifecycle marketing. For example, I drove a 670% increase in 'vets favoriting hospitals,' enabling targeted retention campaigns that saved millions in GMV.
Marketplace levers: I focus on high-leverage marketplace optimizations‚Äîpricing, matching algorithms, incentives‚Äîthat unlock incremental revenue without adding supply or demand.
